weather_report:
As the afternoon eases into evening, Downtown San Francisco basks in a gentle sun, the skies painted in serene blue greeting the day. The temperatures now dance around a pleasant 65 degrees, but watch closely as they dip into the cool embrace of the 50s as twilight approaches. A lively west wind whispers through the streets, carrying both the freshness of the ocean and the promise of a brisk evening. 

While the sun brightens the city, hints of a marine layer linger at the edges—soft tendrils of fog weaving gracefully towards the Golden Gate. The fog, at bay for now, reminds us of its ever-present charm, ready to sneak in as the night descends. Layering up is wise; perhaps a light jacket or a cozy sweater will keep the evening chill at bay while you stroll through the lively streets or settle at a quaint café. As the sun lowers, consider mingling with friends at a local eatery, where the warmth of good company can rival that of the fading daylight. A quiet walk along the Embarcadero can lend itself to wonderful reflections as the water glistens in the receding sunlight—an invitation to savor the day’s simple joys.
